oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Margaret's Grocery and Market: main structure wall and entrance arch
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Old U.S. Highway 61, Vicksburg, Warren County, MS
Color photograph of the front entrance colorful rock wall and arched entrance with signs above it

Margaret's Grocery and Market is a notable folk art site on old Hwy. 61 north of Vicksburg, MS. Originally a rural grocery store, it became known for the folk art of Rev. H.D. Dennis, who converted his wife's commercial business into a roadside church and religious attraction in the 1980s. Margaret Dennis died in 2009 and Rev. Harmon D. Dennis in 2011.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Folk art
folk art;
Private art collections; Historic buildings
